articles.title: Greetings to Mongolian Democratic Party
articles.content:
Greetings to Mongolian Democratic Party
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Sunday sent a message of greeting to the Central Executive Committee of the Mongolian Democratic Party on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of its founding.
					 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties would develop on good terms in the future, too, the message wished the party greater success in its activities for the prosperity and the development of the country.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive's Call for "Cooperation in Anti-DPRK Nuclear Racket" under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive's Call for "Cooperation in Anti-DPRK Nuclear Racket" under Fire 
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Days ago, the south Korean chief executive made a tour of European countries to solicit outside forces for "cooperation in the anti-DPRK nuclear racket" again. 
					 Meanwhile, the south Korean authorities together with the U.S. and Japan went busy, opening the meeting of the chief negotiators for the six-party talks for exploring the way of "cooperation over north Korea". 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a commentary says in this regard:
					
					 The south Korean authorities have persistently begged outside forces for intensified "cooperation in the anti-DPRK nuclear racket," but in vain. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities have no qualifications whatsoever to vociferate about "north Korea's abandonment of nuclear program" as they are making frantic efforts to ignite a nuclear war against it in collusion with outside forces. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should stop their provocative moves of aggravating the tension on the Korean Peninsula and increasing the danger of a nuclear war while actively joining in the U.S. nuclear racket against the compatriots in the north before begging outsiders for the above-said "cooperation." 
					
					 The more the south Korean executive tightens nexus with outsiders under the signboard of "cooperation in the anti-DPRK nuclear racket" prompted by her sinister ambition, the more the way to the improvement of the north-south relations will become distant and confrontation and tension will be escalated. 
					
					 No matter how desperately the south Korean authorities may intensify
					
					the above-said cooperation, they can never shake the resolution and will 
					
					of the DPRK. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to discontinue take trouble for such a useless farce but mind their own business which has gone bankrupt.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Give up Concept of Confrontation
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Give up Concept of Confrontation 
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The north and the south of Korea should boldly part from the past of distrust and confrontation and open a new history of the inter-Korean relations through dialogue and cooperation in conformity with the expectation and desire of the whole nation, Rodong Sinmun Sunday says in an article. 
					 To give up the old concept of confrontation is a prerequisite for opening a new history of the north-south relations, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The one-sided viewpoint and stand on confrontation is the product of the treacherous way of thinking disregarding the destiny of the nation, and an important factor hindering the improvement of the north-south relations. 
					
					 The tragic situation of the inter-Korean relations is not accidental but the inevitable result of the south Korean authorities' ill-intended inveterate repugnancy and hostility toward the ideology and system in the DPRK. 
					
					 If the south Korean authorities give up the old concept of confrontation in a bold way and sincerely come out for improved north-south relations, the relations will radically develop and major problems for national reunification and co-prosperity of the nation will successfully be solved. 
					
					 It is an important guarantee of writing a new history of the inter-Korean relations to turn the north-south dialogue into the constructive one for substantial successes with the proper attitude and stand on the dialogue. 
					
					 Now is the time for the north and the south to put an end to the history of confrontation and pool their efforts and wisdom to open up a new era of reunification in conformity with the demand of the era and desire of the nation. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should face up to the trend of the times and aspiration of the nation and give up the concept of confrontation with the DPRK and come out for the dialogue between the authorities with sincere attitude and stand.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Fascist Suppression of Progressive Forces
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Fascist Suppression of Progressive Forces
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The policemen of the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency conducted search operations against an organization affiliated to the Builders Trade Union and offices of the local trade unions belonging to it on December 2, according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 The authorities hurled at least 100 police detectives, 6 companies of mobile police corps and others into the repressive operations under the pretext that they "planned and spearheaded the violent and radical demonstration".
					
					 Prior to this, the public security authorities searched headquarters of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) and offices of the affiliated bodies on November 21, asserting that the KCTU played a key role in various struggle including the one held with the first anniversary of the ferry Sewol disaster as an occasion and the May Day rally.
					
					 Shortly ago, they made the search operation against the office of the Kyonggi Provincial Headquarters of the KCTU and were busy with "securing evidence" to prove the "violent act".
					
					 The fascist police, stooge of those in power, are persistently resorting to human rights violations to put down the workers' struggle against the traitorous rule.

articles.title: IS Fabrication of Spy Case Denounced in S. Korea
articles.content:
IS Fabrication of Spy Case Denounced in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The "Christian Pastors' Group for Peaceful Action", the Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy, the Solidarity for Progress and other bodies of south Korea held a press conference in Kwanghwamun Square in Seoul on December 1 to denounce the Intelligence Service (IS) for creating terror-ridden atmosphere by cooking up a false spy case, according to the south Korean internet paper Jaju Sibo. 
					 Speakers said that the IS stormed and searched the houses of Revs. Kim Song Yun and Choe Jae Bong and personages of labor circle under the pretext of spy case on November 13. 
					
					 The search indicates the sinister intent of the security authorities to suppress people of different social standings by linking the November 14 all-out people's action with the north, the speakers said. 
					
					 They demanded the abolishment of the "Security Law" violating human rights and the disbandment of the IS. 
					
					 At the end of the press conference participants chanted such slogans as "Abolish Security Law," "Release prisoners of conscience," "Ensure freedom of expression" and "We denounce IS." 
					
					 Members of civic and social organizations and religionists of south Korea held a meeting outside the IS on the same day in demand of the abolishment of the "Security Law" and disbandment of the IS and declared they would launch a massive action.

articles.title: Moves to Reinstall Aegibong Light Tower Opposed
articles.content:
Moves to Reinstall Aegibong Light Tower Opposed 
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Civic organizations in Kimpho City, Kyonggi Province of south Korea held a press conference on December 4 in protest against the moves to reinstall the Aegibong Light Tower for anti-DPRK psychological warfare, according to the south Korean CBS. 
					 Speakers there said that if the Aegibong Light Tower is reinstalled, the region will become insecure, expressing strong opposition to it.

articles.title: Korean in U.S. Supports Second All-out People's Action in S. Korea
articles.content:
Korean in U.S. Supports Second All-out People's Action in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Koreans in the U.S. are actively supporting the south Koreans' efforts to hold the second all-out people's action against the ruling quarters' suppression in south Korea, according the south Korean internet paper Jaju Sibo on December 2. 
					 Korean Rev. in the U.S. Kim Tong Gyun said that Koreans in the U.S. would launch demonstrations in different parts of the U.S. on Nov. 4 and 5 in denunciation of the violent south Korean regime in solidarity with the second all-out people's action in Seoul. 
					
					 He also released an article calling upon Koreans in the U.S. to launch actions in America against the present south Korean regime, saying that they have an experience of having fought against the rules of the preceding dictators of south Korea, Syngman Rhee, Park Chung-Hee and Chun Doo Hwan.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Letter Posted by British Organization on Its Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Letter Posted by British Organization on Its Website
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The full text of the letter sent by Marshal Kim Jong Un to the participants in the 4th Conference of Frontrunners of the Three-Revolution Red Flag Movement "Let Us Bring About a Fundamental Turn in the Three-Revolution Red Flag Movement in Line with the Demands of the Developing Revolution" was posted by the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on its website on Nov. 30.
					 The website carried a photo of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Denmark
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Denmark
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- A national committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Copenhagen, Denmark on Nov. 30.
					 H. Jacobsen, member of the Leadership of the Communist Party in Denmark, and Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, were elected co-chairmen of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Iceland
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Iceland
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering Comrade Kim Jong Il was formed in Iceland on Dec. 1.
					 Jon Arni Halldorsson, general secretary of the Iceland-DPRK Friendship and Cultural Society, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events to praise the revolutionary career and exploits of leader Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in India
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in India
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- An Indian committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in New Delhi on Dec. 1.
					 The general secretary of the Indian National Congress Party was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Mexico
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Mexico
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- A Mexican national committee for remembering Comrade Kim Jong Il was formed on Dec. 1.
					 Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events including a seminar, lecture, photo exhibition and film show to praise the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Observed by Iranian Paper
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Observed by Iranian Paper
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The Iranian paper Iran News on Nov. 29 carried an article titled "Eternal Chairman of the National Defence Commission" illustrated with a photo of smiling leader Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.
					 The article said that Kim Jong Il is the eternal chairman of the National Defence Commission. It went on:
					
					 He established the state machinery with the NDC as its pivot and provided the foundation for the eternal prosperity of the DPRK by pursuing Songun policy.
					
					 He who took upon himself the destiny of socialist Korea made sure big efforts were directed into bolstering up the military muscle and strengthened the overall national power on the basis of it.
					
					 He held higher the banner of Songun to further prepare the people's army as an army strongest in ideology and faith and invincible one with all powerful offensive and defensive means.
					
					 He also saw to it that definite priority was given to developing the national defense industry and thus put the DPRK's self-supporting defense industry on the latest scientific and technological basis and turned the whole country into an impregnable fortress.
					
					 He firmly consolidated the politico-ideological position of the country and opened a new era of the building of the thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Along with the eternal prosperity of the DPRK, Kim Jong Il's exploits will be remembered forever.
